SDG_GOAL: Goal 3: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
SDG_TARGET: Target 3.3: By 2030, end the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 3.3.1: Number of new HIV infections per 1,000 uninfected population, by sex, age and key populations
SDG_SERIES_DESCR:
Number of new HIV infections [3.3.1]

Rate of new HIV infections per 1,000 uninfected population [3.3.1]
SDG_CUSTODIAN_AGENCIES: The Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS (UNAIDS)
RATIONALE: The incidence rate provides a measure of progress toward preventing onward transmission of HIV. Although other indicators are also very important to the HIV epidemic, HIV incidence reflects success in prevention programs and, to some extent, successful treatment programs, as those will also lead to lower HIV incidence.
COVERAGE: There is no available disaggregation for this indicator.
un_custodian_agency: The Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS (UNAIDS)
